      • getUnwrap

        public double getUnwrap​(GeoBounds bounds)
        Get the longitudinal unwrap value for a set of geo bounds +360 = transform all western hemisphere points to > 360 longitude -360 = transform all eastern hemisphere points to < -360 longitude
        Parameters:
        bounds - Geo bounds
        Returns:
        The unwrap value (360, -360, or 0 for no unwrap)

      • getUnwrap

        public double getUnwrap​(Envelope bounds)
        Same as above but for envelopes, which are used by feature datasets Also does not use 180-degree wrapping, meaning any bounds which cross the IDL are represented with unwrapped longitudinal values (i.e. minX = 179, maxX = 181)
        Parameters:
        bounds - Envelope bounds
        Returns:
        The unwrap value

      • getUnwrap

        public static double getUnwrap​(double eastBoundUnwrapped,
                               double westBoundUnwrapped,
                               GeoBounds bounds)

        public static double getUnwrap​(double eastBoundUnwrapped,
                               double westBoundUnwrapped,
                               Envelope bounds)

      • normalizeHemisphere

        public static int normalizeHemisphere​(int size,
                                      java.nio.DoubleBuffer src,
                                      java.nio.DoubleBuffer dst)
        Normalizes all points relative into a primary hemisphere. Points determined to cross the IDL from the primary hemisphere into the secondary hemisphere will be "unwrapped".
        Parameters:
        size - The number of elements per position, either 2 or 3
        src - The source points, ordered longitude,latitude[,altitude]
        dst - The result points
        Returns:
        A bitmask indicating the primary hemisphere and whether the source geometry crosses the IDL. The MASK_IDL_CROSS bit will be toggled if the source geometry crosses the IDL; the value resulting from applying the MASK_PRIMARY_HEMISPHERE will be one of HEMISPHERE_EAST or HEMISPHERE_WEST.


        int result = GLAntiMeridianHelper.normalizeHemisphere(...);
        boolean crossesIdl = (result&GLAntiMeridianHelper.MASK_IDL_CROSS) != 0;
        int primaryHemi = (result&GLAntiMeridianHelper.MASK_PRIMARY_HEMISPHERE);

      • normalizeHemisphere

        public static int normalizeHemisphere​(GeoPoint a,
                                      GeoPoint b)
        Normalizes the provided points relative to a primary hemisphere. Points determined to cross the IDL from the primary hemisphere into the secondary hemisphere will be "unwrapped".
        Parameters:
        a - The start point of the segment. May be modified if normalization is required
        b - The end point of the segment. May be modified if normalization is required
        Returns:
        A bitmask indicating the primary hemisphere and whether the source geometry crosses the IDL. The MASK_IDL_CROSS bit will be toggled if the source geometry crosses the IDL; the value resulting from applying the MASK_PRIMARY_HEMISPHERE will be one of HEMISPHERE_EAST or HEMISPHERE_WEST.


        int result = GLAntiMeridianHelper.normalizeHemisphere(...);
        boolean crossesIdl = (result&GLAntiMeridianHelper.MASK_IDL_CROSS) != 0;
        int primaryHemi = (result&GLAntiMeridianHelper.MASK_PRIMARY_HEMISPHERE);

      • getUnwrap

        public static double getUnwrap​(GLMapView view,
                               boolean srcCrossesIDL,
                               int srcPrimaryHemi)
        Returns the longitude unwrapping value for source data that has been normalized relative to a primary hemisphere.
        Parameters:
        view - The GLMapView
        srcCrossesIDL - true if the source data crosses the IDL, false otherwise
        srcPrimaryHemi - The primary hemisphere for the source data. One of HEMISPHERE_EAST or HEMISPHERE_WEST
        Returns:
        The value to be added to longitude values of the source data for display, given the current view state
